#Text=2. Methods
#Text=2.1.
#Text=The Framework of the FMIND Based Image Registration Method
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=shows the flowchart of the proposed image registration based on the FMIND .

#Text=Firstly , the FMIND is constructed based on the foveated nonlocal self-similarity and it is applied to the reference image IR and the float image IF to produce the corresponding structural representations FMIND ( IR ) and FMIND ( IF ) , respectively .

#Text=Afterwards , the objective function , i.e. , the energy function , is established based on the free-from deformation ( FFD ) model and the similarity measure defined as the sum of absolute differences ( SAD ) between FMIND( IR ) and FMIND( IF ) .
#Text=Finally , the FMIND based spatial constraint is introduced to produce the mask image for the MRF discrete optimization .
#Text=During the iterative optimization , the deformation vector , which is a vector of parameters defining the deformation field , is produced at each iteration .
#Text=The final optimal deformation vector T ’ will be obtained once the optimization procedure is terminated , and it is utilized to produce the registration result .
#Text=2.2.
#Text=The Foveated Modality Independent Neighborhood Descriptor
#Text=The FMIND is presented based on the characteristics of human visual system ( HVS ) .
#Text=In the HVS , the distribution of cone cells is uneven .
#Text=The foveation has the highest density .
#Text=If the foveation is taken as the center , the cell density will fall fast when it is extended around .
#Text=The optic nerve cells have similar characteristics .
#Text=Therefore , when we watch a point in an image , this point will have the highest sensitivity and the sensitivity will drop with the increasing distance to the point .

#Text=Inspired by the characteristics of the HVS , Alessandro Foi et al. have proposed calculating the patch similarity based on the Euclidean distance between the the foveated patches , defined as : ( 1 ) where and denote the foveated patches that were obtained by foveating the image at the two fixation points and .
#Text=By applying the foveation operator to the image I , the foveated patch is produced as : ( 2 ) where denotes the location of any pixel in the foveated image patch .
#Text=In , the designed foveation operators mainly include the isotropic and anisotropic foveation operators .
#Text=As the latter has more advantages than the former in describing the image edges and textures , it will be used as the foveation operator .

#Text=This operator is defined as : ( 3 ) where denotes the blur kernel and it is mainly structured by the elliptical Gaussian probability density function ( PDF ) , determines the elongation of the Gaussian PDF , and denotes the angular offset , respectively .
#Text=The blur kernel is defined as : ( 4 ) where , , denote the elliptical Gaussian PDF with the standard deviation of and u + determines the orientation of the axes of the elliptical Gaussian PDF .
#Text=Figure 2
#Text=gives an example of two anisotropic foveation operators , where is a 7 × 7 foveated patch , , and the different kernel elongation parameters and are used , respectively .
#Text=Clearly , this radial design of these anisotropic foveation operators is consistent with HVS features , which thereby leads to the effective structural representation of images for the FMIND .

#Text=We will propose the FMIND based on the foveated nonlocal self-similarity between different image patches in the same image borrowing the idea of self-similarity in the non-local means denoising .

#Text=The FMIND is expressed as : ( 5 ) where denotes a search window centered at x , denotes the distance between the foveated image patches and ; n is a normalization constant to ensure that the maximum of is 1 ; denotes the variance of the foveated image patch centered at x in the image I , and it controls the attenuation degree of this function in Equation ( 5 ) .
#Text=The variance is estimated as the mean of foveated distances for all the pixels in the foveated patch . ( 6 ) where || denotes the number of pixels in .

#Text=The structural information around the pixel x in the image I will be described by one-dimensional vector of size , where | R | denotes the number of pixels in the search window R by means of the FMIND .

#Text=After obtaining the FMIND for the reference and float images , the similarity metric between two pixels at the same position x in the images I and J can be expressed as the mean SAD between and of pixels in R . ( 7 ) where R takes a six-neighborhood in this paper .
